intro: Psychotria guapilensis, commonly known as the Guapilensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and parts of the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Psychotria guapilensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
